page.title: 02Willoughby's Legendary Horse
page.content: As a busy junction Willoughby had sidings and shunting shire horses. The story has it that such a horse called "Dobbin" was killed by a train while working in the yard about 60 years ago. A local poet records the story. This is part of that poem:- "It rushed through Alford's busy station,hissing,blowing,wagons clanking, A living thing, a powerful thing driven on by fire and steam and cared for by its driver. A thud, a shout, brakes screech, sparks fly as metal wheels scrape Metal lines grating to a halt too late as further up the line it stopped." (Stuart Reder) While the site of the yard was being cleared 10 years ago a very large horseshoe was found that is reputed to have belonged to Dobbin.
